a.style: font-family:"Playfair Display", Georgia, "Times New Roman", serif

text.tspan: Global Hunger Index vs. extreme poverty
The Global Hunger Index measured against the share of the population living in extreme poverty (living on less
than 1.90 international dollars a day at 2011 prices). The GHI comprises of four key hunger indicators: prevalence
of undernourishment in the total population; childhood wasting; childhood stunting; and child mortality. This
calculation results in GHI scores on a 100-point scale where 0 is the best score (no hunger) and 100 the
Source: Global Hunger Index - IFPRI (2018), PovCal (2021)
